document.docAuthor: Liu, Dong, Wu, Donghui & Chen, Jun
document.masterDocTitle: Review of Plonaphacarus (Acari: Oribatida: Steganacaridae), with descriptions of eight new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of Plonaphacarus (Acari: Oribatida: Steganacaridae), with descriptions of eight new species from China

bibRefCitation.refString: Aoki, J. (1980) A revision of the oribatid mites of Japan. I. The families Phthiracaridae and Oribotritiidae. Bulletin of the Institute of Environmental Science and Technology, Yokohama National University, 6 (2), 1 - 89.

bibRefCitation.refString: Bayoumi, B. M. & Mahunka, S. (1979) Ergebnisse der Bhutan-Expedition 1972 des naturhistorischen museums in Basel, Acari: Oribatida (Part I.). Entomologica Basiliensia, 4, 13 - 30.

Measurements of adults: Prodorsum: length 230–255 , width 170–195 , height 90–125 , setae: ss 80–85 , ro 40– 43 , in 110–115 , le 25–30 , ex 10 , distance between setae: ro -ro 30–35 , in -in 50–70 , le -le 90–120 ; notogaster: length 370–485 , width 310–375 , height 290–380 ; setae: c

65 ; genitoaggenital plate 150 × 110 , anoadanal plate 215 × 100 .

Surface of body covered with small concavities. Lateral carinae strong and long, extend beyond sinus and reach end of rostrum; dorsal and lateral region distinct; posterior furrows present; sensilli long with narrow pedicel and sickle-like head, covered with short spines; interlamellar setae long, robust, erect, barbed in distal half; lamellar and rostral setae spiniform, short, rough and semi-erect; exobothridial setae short and fine; comparative length: in>ss > ro > le>ex . Notogaster with 15 pairs of setae, medium long ( c
1
< c
1
-d
1
), robust, barbed in distal half; two pairs of lyrifissures ia and im present. Nine pairs of genital setae present with formula: 6 ( 4 + 2 ): 3 ; one pair of aggenital setae present; anoadanal plates each with five rough and well-developed setae. Setae h of mentum shorter than distance between them; chaetotaxy of legs (without tarsi): I: 1-4 - 2 ( 2 )- 5 ( 1 ); II: 1-3 - 2 ( 1 )- 3 ( 1 ), III: 2 - 2 - 1 ( 1 )- 2 ( 1 ), IV: 2 - 1 - 1-2 ( 1 ); v’’ / v’ (femora I)= 2.17 ; setae d on femora I situated far from distal end of article; all legs monodactylous.
Distribution. China (Beijing, Chongqing, Fujian, Hainan, Jiangsu, Jilin, Sichuan, Taiwan ), cosmopolitan distribution except Europe.
